description:
Create custom C# mixins with this Fody add-in.

Supports:
* Mixins containing fields, methods, properties, events, and nested types.
* Public, private, protected, internal, and protected internal members.
* Static members
* Custom attributes on members
* Virtual members
* Abstract nested types and abstract members within these nested types

Unsupported:
* Mixin constructors
* Mixin type initializers
* Generics within mixins
* Initialization on fields
* Unmanaged code calls (extern)
* Security attributes
* Mixins implementing mulitple interfaces
* Mixins with base types other than object
* Value type mixins

Tricky Stuff:
* Initialized fields in mixin implementation types will silently lose initialization in the mixin target type
* Parameterless constructors in mixin implementation types will silently not copy logic into the target type.
releaseNotes:
Bix.Mixers will now find mixin definitions and implementations in assemblies located in two additional places.

In the bin\Debug or bin\Release directory of the mixin target project.

Tools subdirectory of the Visual studio solution directory. (Previously, this was searched only if Fody found the Bix.Mixers.Fody.dll file there, which isn't the case for a NuGet install.)

Mixin definitions will already be referenced by the target assembly since they must specify them within the InterfaceMixinAttribute constructor. Now Bix.Mixers will correctly find these with no additional work per (1) above.

Because other projects may not reference the mixin implementation assembly, it is recommended that it be copied to the Tools solution directory to be found per (2) above. Something like this will work in the postbuild event: copy "$(TargetPath)" "$(SolutionDir)Tools".
summary: Create custom C# mixins with this Fody add-in.
title: Bix.Mixers.Fody
